title: Telling players to kill themselves is not a joke!
body: So I just finished a match of league, and I was mid going 1-1-0 so not too bad. Top lane was 0/6 so we tried telling him to play defensive when he starts telling me to "Kill myself in real life", the players name was MoostaR on the oce servers. Now I reported him for that, but I doubt that will do anything. What if next time he tells someone to kill themselves and they really take it to heart? A friend of mine who isn't great at LoL sometimes gets stressed out when he does bad and gets flamed for it. What if he was there when this guy was saying "Kill yourself in real life", that's disgusting Riot. Maybe give summoners a friendly reminder you don't accept this kind of behavior? Anyway, RANT OVER!

replies.body:
If you kill yourself because somebody you don't know told you to, then chances are you probably couldn't get through life anyway. Although, someone trying to take their own life because they've convinced themselves to commit suicide is a different scenario. Grow a pair of jimmies and avoid rustling.

inb4 SJWs.
You missed the ENTIRE point, the point is no one should tell anyone to kill themselves. Thats just messed up!

I know that, I was talking about the person receiving the hateful speech.

Just shrug it off. If it really is a problem, just realize you're not a twelvie that mains Pantheon telling others to kill themselves over the internet.

Mute and carry on. As harsh as it sounds, I kindof agree with Rav.

That said, if growing a pair of jimmies seems like a daunting task in the face of online abuse then in all seriousness get in touch with an organisation which can help.

https://www.lifeline.org.au/

Just because something is the way it is, doesnt mean it is okay and should not be addressed. People need to be held accountable for their actions, be it in real life or in a fantasy world. If things like this go unchecked online, whats stopping these people from doing it in real life? Its a fine line and its not as simple as just get over it for some people. I know freedom of speech and expression blah blah, but this is abuse, and it should be taken more seriously than it is. /rant

Problem is some people do play this as an escape from depression.
A toxic community can make someone feel worse.
It's not a matter of growing a pair, people are wired differently.

In that case, I don't know anything about it to be honest.

Perhaps find a different game? Play a single player game? Because society is a bunch of assholes.

If someone died just cos strangers on the internet tells them to do so, i would say go for it, theres more to life to handle other than an online game. If you cant even handle the simplest stress of an online game what else would you succeed on?
I give up......

Can Riot actually stop what people types onto the screen? No.

What they did for us:
1. Report. (It works)
2. Ignore/mute.
3. Language filter.
4. Disabled all chat by default.

Are these not enough already? 

Not to mention "Kill yourself" is so overused, atm when somebody says that it's almost comical. There are things that is way more vile floating in the game's chat.

I do get my jimmies rustled from time to time, but that's not saying it's Riot's fault but mine and the other guy's who thinks he's tough on the net. 

I SHOULD just ignore any negativity getting thrown at me and brush it off like nothing (with/without the use of the above features provided), also remember to report and mute the stupid man. This is the attitude you need.

1. Doesn't work
2. Works
3. What are you a fgt?
4. Now that's no fun.

So you like crying after you get your jimmies rustled?

Yer there is also you gitting gud and not caring but that doesn't mean those features ain't there.

And reports do work, just hella slow for the time being.

Well technically reports don't work right now, they are just getting saved for when the new Tribunal is released next year.

However there was a post way back that Support Tickets on Riot's main no nos will get results.

Telling someone to commit suicide.
Sexism.
Homophobia.
Racism.


You send a Support Ticket about those four and something WILL be done. They were also the target for the auto-bans on NA, where chat was monitored by the auto-ban system for trigger phrases.

I'm not sure if they're being saved or not, in a recent "where are reports going" post on reddit the rioter just talked about the player behavior systems NA has.

http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2pdinq/if_the_tribunal_is_down_where_exactly_are_our/

Here's the post, no mention of them being stored

While there is no mention of it there, we've had mention previously of this.

I've seen several posts on OCE forums alone that the reports are being saved for the new system, we've also had confirmation on EU servers and NA.

They do player behaviour sweeps from time to time using the logged reports but it is not an instant karma kindof gig and it takes time for them to process and they only get rid of the biggest possible D-bags on the server and leave some of the lesser D-bags to work their horrid pelvic sorcery.

They did do that yes. However we've not heard anything about the hand dealt bans in months and months.
It's safe to think they've stopped doing those.

When did i say i like crying after i get my jimmies rustled?

My comment had nothing to do with that.

Reports don't work.

Also, dont think your the only one who gets told 'bad things'.
My only game today made me not want to play another for the rest of the day due to how it turned out and the constant antagonising i had from both ingame and realife. Needless to say, it was long till i got over it, despite the constant badgering.

TLDR get over it, i deal with the same %%%% and get over it.

It all comes down to yourself how offensive it is in the end, I very often find myself thinking about suicide but if some guy in game says "kill yourself" (or anything for that matter) it will just pass right through me because I don't care what some random guy who doesn't know me thinks about my life. Some people just have to build up their resistance to this kind of thing because really you shouldn't be playing online games if you can't handle being told mean things.
